intro: Alsine bartolottii, commonly known as the Bartolotti's sandmat, is a low-growing annual plant native to arid and semi-arid regions of southern Africa. It belongs to the family Amaranthaceae and is characterized by its succulent, fleshy leaves and small, greenish flowers. The plant typically thrives in sandy or gravelly soils and is adapted to withstand drought conditions. Its short life cycle allows it to complete its growth and reproduction quickly in response to seasonal rainfall. Due to its hardy nature, it is often found in disturbed or unvegetated areas.
